title: How to Choose the Right GHD Hair Styling Tools
excerpt: At Salon Edit, we know that the correct hair styling tools are essential for achieving your dream hair.
content:
GHD Styling

At Salon Edit, we know that the correct hair styling tools are essential for achieving your dream hair. Whether aiming for sleek, straight locks, voluminous waves, or perfectly defined curls, having the right tools in your arsenal is essential. That's why we're excited to stock GHD, a brand synonymous with innovation, quality, and exceptional styling results.

GHD stands for “Good Hair Day” and has revolutionised the hair styling industry with its cutting-edge technology and commitment to excellence. Their range of hair styling tools is designed for every hair type and styling need, ensuring that you can achieve professional-quality results from the comfort of your home.

Factors to Consider When Choosing GHD Hair Styling Tools

Hair Type: Your hair type is the foundation of your styling routine. Whether you have fine, thick, or curly hair, selecting a GHD tool that caters to your needs is crucial.

Styling Goals: What styles are you aiming to achieve? If you love sleek, straight locks, a tool with consistent heat distribution like the GHD Platinum+ is ideal.

Technology: Advanced features significantly improve your styling experience. Look for tools with ultra-zone or dual-zone technology, which ensures optimal heat distribution and consistent results.

Consultation with Salon Edit Stylists

Personalised Advice: We offer personalised consultations to assess your hair type and styling goals.

Try Before You Buy: Experience our GHD tools in-salon to ensure they meet your expectations.

title: Balayage vs. Traditional Highlights: What's the Difference?
excerpt: Balayage vs. Traditional Highlights: What's the Difference? At Salon Edit, choosing the correct hair colouring technique makes all the difference.
content:
Balayage vs. Traditional Highlights

Balayage is a freehand colouring technique where the stylist paints highlights onto the hair in a sweeping motion. The result is soft, sun-kissed gradations with less obvious regrowth lines.

Traditional (foil) highlights use foils to isolate hair sections and lift pigment in a controlled, repeatable pattern. This method gives a more uniform, higher-contrast look and can cover larger areas quickly.

Key Differences

  • Placement and Finish: Balayage gives a softer, blended result; traditional highlights provide more uniform streaks and higher contrast.
  • Maintenance: Balayage often requires less frequent touch-ups; traditional highlights may need more regular maintenance.
  • Customisation: Balayage excels at bespoke, face-framing looks; foil highlights are ideal for precise lightening.

Both techniques benefit from professional toning and homecare to maintain colour and minimise brassiness. Book a consultation to see which method suits you.

title: Gloss Toner and the Root Stretch: Hair Perfection
excerpt: Gloss Toner and the Root Stretch: Whether you want to enhance your hair's shine or create a seamless, low-maintenance colour blend.
content:
Gloss Toner and Root Stretch

A gloss toner is a demi-permanent glossing service that refreshes tone, adds shiny finish, and seals the cuticle. A root stretch blends natural root into lightened mid-lengths and ends for a soft regrowth line.

Benefits

  • Instant Shine: Glossing imparts a glossy finish and reduces the appearance of damage.
  • Colour Correction: Neutralises slight brass without heavy processing.
  • Lower Maintenance: Root stretches extend time between full re-colours.

These services are perfect for a quick salon refresh or to prepare for an event. Ask your stylist how a gloss and root stretch can work for you.

title: Keratin Blow Dry: Smooth, Shiny, and Manageable Hair
excerpt: Keratin Blow Dry: Transform frizzy or unruly hair into a sleek, manageable finish.
content:
Keratin Blow Dry

If you're looking to transform frizzy or unruly hair into a sleek, manageable finish, a Keratin Blow Dry at Salon Edit may be the perfect solution. This treatment infuses keratin into the hair shaft and smooths the cuticle using heat.

Process Overview

  1. Consultation and hair assessment to choose the correct formula.
  2. Clarifying wash to remove buildup.
  3. Application of the keratin solution and blow-dry.
  4. Flat-iron to seal the treatment and aftercare advice.
